title: Ms. Locked-In
description:
Sarah Langs joins Buster and Karl Ravech to talk about publicly announcing her ALS diagnosis, the outpouring of support from the baseball community and what it is about baseball that she loves. Then, Langs plays The Numbers Game with thoughts on Juan Soto being the young veteran, out-homering your opponent, Max Scherzer’s 10K games in the postseason and which of the wild card weekend teams has the best chance to make the World Series. Next, Ravech on the Six Degrees of Kevin Bacon with Mets-Padres, the Mets’ pitching strategy, the Soto antidote, Toronto’s home field advantage and his concern for Shane McClanahan. Later, Hembo makes his to triumphant return to the pod to discuss parenting twin girls, the Rays-Guardians rock fight, the Phillies’ starting pitching advantage and his lack of confidence in San Diego.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
itunes:author: ESPN, Buster Olney
itunes:subtitle: LISTEN: Buster, Karl Ravech, Sarah Langs and Hembo preview what looks to be a wild, Wild Card Weekend
